alert.note: Alert for Western Columbia River Gorge (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 03 at 9:51PM PST until March 04 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT ABOVE 700 FEET FROM 4 AM TO 4 PM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches 700 feet and higher, except less than one inch below 700 feet. * WHERE...In Oregon, Western Columbia River Gorge. In Washington, Western Columbia River Gorge. * WHEN...From 4 AM to 4 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels are expected to reach between 500 and 1000 feet late Friday night and continue through Saturday morning. This means the most likely outcome for the lower elevations is a dusting at most. However, there is a 20-30% chance of snow amounts in excess of 1 inch close to river level should snowfall rates exceed 1 inch per hour early Saturday morning. If snow becomes dominant, snow will switch back to rain by 11 AM PST Saturday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
